item.title: Shotzzy is Still Haunted by THAT Interview and Needs to ‚ÄòGet His Get Back‚Äô
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/shotzzy-haunted-interview-london-cod-league/

Shotzzy is one of the most decorated esports players in the business. He‚Äôs one of just two competitors to secure a world title in two games, and he‚Äôs a multi-time champion and MVP. In the Call of Duty League, he‚Äôs known as one of the most consistently entertaining and capable players, taking up a key spot on OpTic Texas.

But he‚Äôs still not over the interview he gave in London in 2020. During the Madrid Major between January and February 2025, I sat down with Shotzzy and Huke behind the scenes, asking them where they‚Äôd like to go next in Europe.

Redemption Story

OpTic Texas fell hard in the Madrid Major, being knocked out of the elimination bracket by a dominant Carolina Royal Ravens side. For a while, OpTic Texas was the favourite to win, coming into the season hot off a win at COD Champs 2024. The team put up a solid fight, but it wasn‚Äôt enough to overcome the competition.

Most recently, OpTic Texas was in the news because Pred, who went on a hiatus from the squad in December 2024, rejoined the team, knocking Huke out of his temporary spot on the roster.

In 2020, Shotzzy journeyed to London with Dallas Empire, the team with which he‚Äôd win the Call of Duty League Championship later that year. He gave an iconic interview, but it seemed that the bright lights of the big stage put the young superstar on edge, and this was the result:

Speaking to Shotzzy in Madrid, I learned that the interview had never left his mind. When I asked if he and Huke would consider going to London for another Call of Duty tournament, Shotzzy said:

I‚Äôd say London, yeah. I need to do ‚Äî I had a really bad interview back then, in London. I‚Äôve got to get my get back on that interview.

Since that interview, Shotzzy has gone on to win two world championships in the Call of Duty space and is one of the most entertaining and charismatic players on the mic, so it‚Äôs safe to say that if he goes back to London, he‚Äôll be able to ‚Äòget his get back‚Äô.

What‚Äôs your favourite Shotzzy moment from the last few years? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more esports news, check out the bracket that has been locked in for the Six Invitational 2025

item.title: Six Invitational 2025 Playoffs Bracket Locked In
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/six-invitational-playoffs-bracket-confirmed/

The Six Invitational 2025 is unravelling in Boston, and the group stage has already provided stacks of entertainment. Most recently, I covered comments made by M80‚Äôs Gunnar following a win over Team Liquid. Thanks to the work of M80, Team Liquid sits in the bottom of the bracket going forward.

The full bracket is now locked in and we have our first matches confirmed for the Six Invitational 2025 playoffs. There are some gems hidden within the fixtures, including a clash between M80 and DarkZero and a face-off between FaZe Clan and SSG that‚Äôll see one team move on to face G2 Esports, the tournament favourite.

Six Invitational Playoffs Are Finally Here

G2 Esports has stormed to the top of the standings ahead of the Six Invitational 2025, securing the top seed and earning a bye. The team performed masterfully in the group stage, refusing to drop a map and effortlessly walking all over M80, Liquid, JOEL, and Unwanted.

Alongside Team BDS, Virtus, and FURIA, G2 earned that all-important bye to automatically move one step further in the bracket at the Six Invitational.

On the other end of the spectrum, Team Falcons, Liquid, Oxygen, and CAG have all found themselves in a critical spot in the elimination bracket.

Here are the opening matches for the Six Invitational 2025 playoffs bracket:

  • w7m Esports vs. Unwanted
  • FaZe Clan vs. Spacestation
  • Razah vs. Shopify Rebellion
  • M80 vs. DarkZero

From the group stage, JOEL, Team Secret, PSG, and SCARZ were all sent home without making it out of their respective groups. It‚Äôs unfortunate, but both SCARZ and JOEL failed to win a single map in the tournament ‚Äì but they don‚Äôt go home empty-handed. Even the bottom-placing teams win $35,000 apiece.

The grand final of the Six Invitational 2025 will take place in Boston on February 16, and it‚Äôll feature an intense best-of-five series. The winning team will secure $1 million, which is one of the biggest single prizes in esports. For the second-place team, there‚Äôs still a handsome prize worth $450,000 waiting for them.

Who do you have winning the Six Invitational this year:? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming esports, check out the news that Pred is back on OpTic Texas in the CDL

item.title: Is PlayStation Network Down? ‚Äì How to Check PSN Server Status
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/is-playstation-network-down-guide-server-status/

The PlayStation Network is the critical backbone of Sony‚Äôs entertainment infrastructure, supporting tens of millions of gamers worldwide. Today, our digital, ever-connected world depends on these services staying online ‚Äì and if they go down, players everywhere will panic. In this guide, I‚Äôll teach you how to check the PSN server status in a couple of seconds.

If you‚Äôre sitting there enjoying a game and suddenly discover you‚Äôve been thrown offline, your first question will be: ‚ÄòIs PlayStation Network down?‚Äô That‚Äôs just common sense ‚Äì but it might not be immediately obvious how to check service status of PSN.

Read on to learn what you need to do if PlayStation Network is down.

Check if PlayStation is Offline

The easiest way to know if the PlayStation Network is down is to check the central PSN service status page. This is the most common way gamers will check if the PlayStation Network is offline or experiencing any issues.

On the network service status page, you‚Äôll see a breakdown between various services, including:

  • Account management
  • Gaming and social
  • PlayStation Video
  • PlayStation Store
  • PlayStation Direct

It might be that one area of the PlayStation Network is down while the rest is online as normal, so make sure the PSN server status page is your first port of call in a suspect outage.

How to Check if PSN is Down on Twitter

If you want to use Twitter (X) to determine if the PlayStation Network is offline, you‚Äôre best off following the ‚ÄòAsk PlayStation‚Äô profile. This page is managed directly by Sony PlayStation, but admittedly, it‚Äôs not the swiftest solution to get updates on PSN server status issues.

Otherwise, you can conduct general searches across social media to see if any gamers are experiencing PlayStation Network outages, or you can use a service like Down Detector to gauge the situation.

If the PlayStation Network is down worldwide, you‚Äôll soon know about it. With the way modern gaming solutions work, when the PSN goes offline, you won‚Äôt be able to access anything worthwhile on your PlayStation console. It‚Äôs a huge pitfall for today‚Äôs ever-connected world, and it‚Äôs a crux we have to handle as gamers.

When was PlayStation Network Down?

On February 8, 2025, the PlayStation Network was plunged into darkness for several hours, with gamers worldwide taking to social media to vent their frustration. One of the kickers of this situation was that almost nothing was addressed by Sony, and just a comment was made on social media ‚Äì and then nothing more for hours.

You can read more about this PSN outage here.

In October 2024, an outage lasting several hours occurred, with players losing access to every area of the PlayStation Network.

Do you have a different way to check if the PlayStation Network is down? Let us know what you do in the comments.

item.title: Developing: PlayStation Network Down Worldwide
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/playstation-network-down-worldwide/

LATEST UPDATE 9:00PM ET: Sony has published on social media that it is ‚Äúaware some users might be currently experiencing issues with PSN.‚Äù They then point people to the official PlayStation Network status page for updates where it says they are ‚Äúworking to resolve the issue as soon as possible.‚Äù

As of this update, the service remains offline.

ORIGINAL: It‚Äôs not just you. The PlayStation Network is down for everyone.

Outages began appearing around 6pm ET, according to multiple reports. A visit to the official PlayStation status page shows that all services are down, including the PlayStation Store, gaming, account management, and more.

As of writing there is no official word from PlayStation regarding the outage. Nor is there any idea as to when service will be restored.

Based on a preliminary check, it appears to be only PlayStation Network suffering issues. Other major online services such as Xbox Live, Nintendo Online, and Steam appear to be working as expected.

Insider Gaming will continue to provide updates as they become available.

Developing story‚Ä¶

For more Insider Gaming, find out what game soon-to-be former president of Insomniac Games Ted Price pitched to PlayStation that was never approved and check out what Balatro developer LocalThunk said about the game‚Äôs next major update. And don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our newsletter

After GTA 6‚Äôs Fall 2025 release window was reconfirmed, Take-Two‚Äôs stocks have reached an all-time high. Here are more details.

Details for the next major Balatro update are intentionally being kept under wraps by the game‚Äôs developer, LocalThunk.

Hasbro and Legendary Entertainment have announced Magic: The Gathering Film and TV universe. Here are more details.

item.title: ‚ÄòYou Just Can‚Äôt Beat Me‚Äô ‚Äì M80 Gunnar Goes Off Against Liquid at Six Invitational
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/m80-gunnar-team-liquid-six-invitational/

Earlier today, M80 dominated Team Liquid in the group stage of the Six Invitational 2025 tournament. This super-sized event boasts a $3 million prize pool and is one of the most important tournaments in the annual esports calendar, so it comes as no surprise that emotions can run wild.

Following the 2 ‚Äì 1 win over Team Liquid, M80‚Äôs Shaun ‚ÄòGunnar‚Äô Pottorff blew up behind the scenes, with the moments after the victory just about being captured by M80‚Äôs social team.

‚ÄòIt Doesn‚Äôt Matter What Team I‚Äôm On‚Äô

Gunnar has been around the block against Team Liquid. The comments he made following M80‚Äôs win in the group stage of this year‚Äôs Six Invitational were backed up by cold, hard numbers. In recent years, Gunnar has taken down Team Liquid while being a part of three separate rosters.

He did it with Soniqs, then against with beastcoast, and now with M80.

After our WIN vs LIQUID ‚ûû Take a look INSIDE the ARENA! üèü

In 2024, Gunnar and beastcoast stormed to success at the BLAST Manchester Major, securing the organisation‚Äôs first major win. That victory included the brutal knocking out of Team Liquid. Beastcoat eliminated the Brazilian squad without dropping a map, before going on to beat Team BDS 3 ‚Äì 2 in the grand final.

Gunnar had sharp words for Team Liquid following today‚Äôs win:

You can‚Äôt beat me! You guys just can‚Äôt beat me. It doesn‚Äôt matter what team I‚Äôm on.

That‚Äôs three different teams ‚Äì you can‚Äôt beat me.

Three different teams, three different rosters, same f***ing results, bro.

M80 picked up the former beastcoast roster following the disbanding of the team in the run-up to the Six Invitational 2025. Thus far in the tournament, M80 has performed pretty well, and at the time of writing, the team sat in second place in the group, just a few points behind G2 Esports, the favourite to win the event.

This weekend, the Six Invitational will depart the group stage and enter the playoffs bracket, with the bottom teams in each group being effectively eliminated from the running.

Are you enjoying this year‚Äôs Six Invitational? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming esports, check out Derke‚Äôs insane VALORANT play

item.title: Take-Two Stock Hits All-Time High After GTA 6 Update
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/take-two-stock-hits-all-time-high-after-gta-6-update/

Take-Two stocks have reached an all-time high after reconfirming that GTA 6 will be releasing fall 2025. 

Spotted by videotechuk_ on X, after CEO Strauss Zelnick reaffirmed a fall 2025 release date for GTA 6 at their recent earnings call, Take-Two‚Äôs stocks started climbing, creating a new record today. Take-Two Interactive Software‚Äôs stock opened at $198, reached a high of almost $213, and closed at $208.77. The company‚Äôs confidence has reassured investors.

GTA 6 is the most anticipated release in the gaming industry, and many publishers do not want to release their games close to Rockstar‚Äôs new instalment. Players were worried, as no news about the game had been revealed since the trailer in December 2023. The community speculated that a delay could be imminent. However, since the game was announced, the developers have stayed strong with the 2025 release window. 

After the CEO of Take-Two recently made a statement, players hope Rockstar will provide more information soon to get them even more excited about Fall 2025. It would be exciting to see some new gameplay and glimpse all the fresh innovations Rockstar may have implemented. 

During the same earnings call, Take-Two‚Äôs CEO spoke about Nintendo‚Äôs upcoming console, Switch 2. However, it wasn‚Äôt confirmed whether their upcoming games, like Grand Theft Auto 6 and Borderlands 4, will be released on the platform. Also, NBA 2K25‚Äôs player spending ‚Äúgreatly surpassed‚Äù expectations. 

What are your thoughts on Take-Two stocks reaching an all-time high? Let us know in the comments or on our new community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Sony turning down the Resistance 4 pitch. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
